headline: Primary Election Results for Georgia, Texas, Alabama and Other States
author: Isabel Martins
sentences:
Newsweek will be reporting on results from the following states:
Texas
Alabama
Georgia
Arkansas
Minnesota
Texas
In one significant Texas race, voters will have to decide between Democrat Henry Cuellar, who openly opposes abortion rights and his challenger Jessica Cisneros, who is in favor of keeping Roe v. Wade in place.

Also on the ballot, State Attorney General Ken Paxton is facing off against an opponent with a well-known political name in the Republican primary, George P. Bush, the son of former Florida Governor Jeb Bush, and the grandson of former President George H.W.

Voters in Georgia, Texas, Alabama, Arkansas and Minnesota are going to the polls today as those states hold their primary elections to determine the representatives for each party in November's general election.

Arkansas
Former White House press secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders, who has been endorsed by Trump, is running for the Republican nomination for governor, she will face off against radio show host Doc Washburn.
The Democratic ballot for governor includes several candidates, including Yolanda Rochelle Flowers, Malika Sanders Fortier, Patricia Salter Jamieson, Arthur Kennedy, Chad Martin and Doug Smith.

Georgia
In Georgia's Republican primary race for governor, incumbent Brian Kemp will face off against former Senator David Perdue, who has been endorsed by former President Donald Trump.

Alabama
In Alabama, incumbent Republican Governor Kay Ivey is facing a crowded primary field with challengers including Lew Burdette, Stacy George, Tim James, and Lynda Blanchard.
These primary elections have come at a crucial political time, as a leaked draft decision from the U.S. Supreme Court indicated that the justices intend to overturn Roe v. Wade.
In the race for Senate in Georgia, former football star Herschel Walker is expected to win the Republican primary, despite allegations of past violent behavior with women.

Minnesota:
The primary ballot has over 20 different political figures from four separate parties, and the polls are set to officially close by 9 p.m.
With this in the news, candidates from both the Republican and Democratic parties have been discussing their support or opposition to abortion.
The full results may take some time longer as election clerks will need to count absentee votes and other ballots received before election day.
On the Democratic side, Bee Nguyen is looking to secure her party's nomination against several candiates.
Current Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger is facing off against Trump-endorsed Jody Hice.
He is endorsed by Trump and does not support abortion, making no exceptions for rape or incest.
Initial results will be available sometime after the polls close on May 24.
The polls are set to close by 8.30 p.m.
When will the results be available?
ET in Arkansas.
Bush.
ET.
